descr: "A sample to be used for analysis."

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Id for container. There may be multiple; a manufacturer's bar code, lab assigned identifier, etc. The container ID may differ from the specimen id in some circumstances."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "The type of container associated with the specimen (e.g. slide, aliquot, etc.)."

fields.name: capacity
fields.descr: "The capacity (volume or other measure) the container may contain."

fields.name: specimenQuantity
fields.descr: "The quantity of specimen in the container; may be volume, dimensions, or other appropriate measurements, depending on the specimen type."

fields.name: additiveCodeableConcept
fields.descr: "Introduced substance to preserve, maintain or enhance the specimen. Examples: Formalin, Citrate, EDTA."

fields.name: additiveReference
fields.descr: "Introduced substance to preserve, maintain or enhance the specimen. Examples: Formalin, Citrate, EDTA."

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from BackboneElement

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces."
 derived from Element
 derived from BackboneElement

fields.name: extension

Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
